author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Inflation in Tokyo rose at a faster pace, supporting the case for the Bank of Japan to keep raising interest rates gradually.
title: Tokyo Inflation Quickens to Support Case for BOJ Rate Hike

author: Tooba Khan, Sherif Tarek
description: Pakistan and Afghanistan agreed to resume peace talks and maintain a ceasefire after mediation efforts by Turkey and Qatar, bolstering hopes the agreement reached between the neighboring countries two weeks ago will hold up.
title: Pakistan, Afghanistan Agree to Resume Peace Talks After Deadlock

author: Catherine Lucey, Emily Chang
description: Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer said she won’t close the door on a 2028 Democratic presidential bid, leaving her options open for what could be a crowded and contentious primary race.
title: Gretchen Whitmer Won’t ‘Rule Out’ 2028 Democratic Presidential Bid

author: Catherine Lucey, Skylar Woodhouse
description: The US will proceed with an investigation that opens the door to new tariffs on goods from China, despite the two nations’ fresh truce, President Donald Trump’s top trade negotiator said.
title: China Tariff Probe to Continue Despite Trump-Xi Deal, Greer Says

author: Gerson Freitas Jr
description: Brazil’s dominance in the market casts shadow over American farmers.
title: Past Will Not Be Prologue on US Soybean Sales to China

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The United Nations said nuclear testing should never be permitted, giving a rare direct rebuke of the US after President Donald Trump ordered his administration to resume such tests after a 33-year moratorium.
title: UN Warns of Nuclear Escalation Risk After Trump Orders New Tests

author: David Gura, Rachael Lewis-Krisky
description: On today’s Big Take podcast, what the US and China gained in the latest trade agreement – and why time is on China’s side.
title: The Winners and Losers of the Trump-Xi Tariff Truce

author: Andreina Itriago
description: María Corina Machado, the latest Nobel Peace Prize recipient, said the Venezuelan opposition has exhausted all of its efforts over the last 26 years. In her view, the country’s authoritarian leader, Nicolás Maduro, won’t listen to reason and must receive a blunter message — even if that means the threat of US military intervention.
title: Nobel Peace Prize Winner Says Maduro’s Time Is Up in Venezuela

author: Jorge Valero
description: A fully-fledged digital euro should only be launched if the private sector doesn’t come up with its own solution to integrate the region’s fractured payments landscape, according to the lead European Union lawmaker on the file.
title: Digital Euro Could Be Curtailed Under EU Lawmaker’s Proposal

author: Brian Dowling, Zoe Tillman
description: A federal judge in Boston signaled she may rule that the Trump administration likely violated US law in suspending food-aid benefits to millions of low-income US households during the government shutdown, and she criticized the “political game” being played with American lives.
title: Judge Blasts ‘Political Game’ Over US Food Aid Suspension

author: Michael D McDonald
description: Honduras’ ruling party accused rivals of plotting an “electoral coup” to steal next month’s presidential vote, stoking tensions in the politically turbulent nation.
title: ‘Electoral Coup’ Claims Fuel Fears Over Upcoming Honduras Vote

author: John Ainger
description: European leaders are likely to show up in force at COP30 despite concerns that some of the world’s biggest emitters will shun the climate conference in Brazil.
title: Macron, Merz to Confirm COP30 Attendance as RSVPs Remain Scant

author: Alicia Diaz
description: The Republican-led Senate passed legislation opposing President Donald Trump’s sweeping global tariffs, its third vote this week rebuking the White House’s trade policies.
title: Senate Snubs Trump on Trade in Third Anti-Tariff Vote This Week

author: Patrick Gillespie
description: The US made a profit on buying Argentine pesos. Wall Street banks, which spent a chunk of October in talks with the Treasury over a plan to line up billions for Javier Milei, haven’t moved forward this week. And Scott Bessent sent a message to Argentine investors: Now it’s your turn.
title: Bessent Tells Investors It’s Their Turn to Rescue Argentina Now

author: Jenny Leonard, Jillian Deutsch, Kamil Kowalcze
description: Germany is considering using public funds to pay Deutsche Telekom AG and other telecom operators to replace Huawei Technologies Co. equipment, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Germany Weighs Paying Deutsche Telekom to Replace Huawei Gear

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: President Donald Trump gave the world an early glimpse of just how loosely he was planning to enforce new US sanctions on Moscow when it comes to China, the single-largest buyer of Russian crude.
title: Trump Leaves Russia Sanctions Pressure In Doubt After Xi Meeting

author: Joe Mayes, Alex Wickham
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s adviser on ministerial standards is looking again at the circumstances surrounding the fact that Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves rented out her family home without a license, after fresh evidence about the case emerged.
title: UK Looks Again Into Reeves Home Rental Amid Fresh Evidence

author: Allyson Versprille, Kate Sullivan
description: US Vice President JD Vance is set to host a roundtable with aviation industry leaders at the White House on Thursday afternoon to discuss the impact of the government shutdown, according to people familiar with the matter, as the administration seeks to ramp up pressure on Democrats over the funding standoff.
title: United, American CEOs to Meet Vance as Shutdown Strains Travel

author: Marton Kasnyik
description: Hungary has drafted legislation on steps to be taken in case of a fuel-supply emergency, just days after a major fire at the country’s sole oil refinery and following a US decision to impose sanctions on Russian energy companies.
title: Hungary Prepares Bill For Fuel Emergencies After Refinery Fire

author: Ethan Bronner, Galit Altstein
description: Tens of thousands of ultra-Orthodox Israelis held a mass rally in Jerusalem, shutting schools, roads and trains, in protest against attempts to end their exemption from military service, an issue threatening the government of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
title: Israel Ultra-Orthodox Rally Against Draft in Threat to Netanyahu

author: William Wilkes, Sarah Jacob
description: Wingtech Technology Co. says any deal to restart Nexperia’s exports from China must include reinstating the Dutch chipmaker’s former chief executive officer, setting a high bar in discussions to resolve the standoff.
title: Nexperia’s Chinese Owner Demands Reinstatement of Ousted CEO

author: Galit Altstein
description: The ongoing trial of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on bribery, fraud and breach of trust charges has altered national politics in Israel. It’s elicited calls by US President Donald Trump for the dismissal of the case, sparking concern over American interference. And it’s bolstered a longstanding sentiment among those on the right in Israel that the courts, which they consider a bastion of the liberal elite, are using the law for political ends and need to be reined in. The government’s effor
title: Why Netanyahu’s Trial Continues to Roil Israel

author: Liam Knox
description: Under Secretary of Education Nicholas Kent wants to overhaul the accreditation system that ties schools to government funds. Agencies are already falling in line.
title: Trump’s College Czar Has a ‘Secret Weapon’ to Transform Campuses

author: Ari Natter, Annmarie Hordern
description: Energy Secretary Chris Wright said the US is prepared to sell more oil and natural gas to China if Beijing cuts back on purchases from Russia.
title: US Is Ready to Sell More Oil and Gas to China, Energy Chief Says

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: A Senate confirmation hearing on Thursday for President Donald Trump’s nominee for US Surgeon General, Casey Means, has been postponed because she has gone into labor, a spokesperson for the Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee said Thursday.
title: US Surgeon General Hearing Delayed After Nominee Goes Into Labor

author: Jeff Sutherland, Ilena Peng
description: China has agreed to buy 12 million metric tons of soybeans this year, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said, providing some relief to US farmers who have anxiously awaited the resumption of exports to the Asian nation.
title: China to Buy 12 Million Tons of Soy This Year, Bessent Says

author: Justin Sink, Colum Murphy
description: US President Donald Trump emerged from his meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping beaming, labeling the conversation “truly great.”
title: Trump-Xi Truce Buys Time as Both Seek Leverage in Broader Fight

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Russia hit energy infrastructure across Ukraine in the largest attack in more than a month as US President Donald Trump made a push to enlist China into helping to end the war.
title: Russian Barrage Hits Power Plants Across Ukraine, Killing Two

author: Chris Anstey
description: US, China agree on truces, limiting the weapons deployed in their competition.
title: Trump and Xi Put Limits on Their Trade War in a ‘12 Out of 10’ Summit

author: Samy Adghirni
description: France’s National Assembly backed a series of tax-raising amendments overnight, casting fresh doubts on whether the government can secure final approval for the 2026 budget by year-end.
title: French Lawmakers Push Tax Hikes on Buybacks, ‘Superdividends’

author: Brian Platt, Soo-Hyang Choi
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney got a close-up view Thursday of the submarines built by the South Korean firm bidding for a government contract worth tens of billions of dollars.
title: Carney Tours Korean Shipyard Ahead of Submarine Decision

author: Ben Sills
description: Russia has resumed military flights to its Hmeimim airbase in Syria after an almost six-month hiatus, as the two countries work to rebuild relations following the toppling of Moscow’s ally, Bashar al-Assad.
title: Russia Renews Flights to Syrian Air Base in Rebuild of Relations

author: Maciej Martewicz
description: Poland’s MiG-29 jets intercepted another Russian reconnaissance aircraft on Thursday, the nation’s Defense Minister Wladyslaw Kosiniak-Kamysz said at a televised briefing, without elaborating.
title: Poland Says Intercepted Russian Reconnaissance Aircraft Again

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban is looking for an economic boost from his meeting with President Donald Trump next week, as well as assurances that Hungary can be shielded from the impact of US sanctions on Russian oil, according to a senior minister.
title: Orban Seeks Russian Oil Sanction Waiver, Deals in Trump Meeting

author: Kateryna Chursina
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said his forces are fighting fierce battles in the strategic eastern city of Pokrovsk as Russia masses troops in an effort to seize control of the stronghold.
title: Zelenskiy Says Battles Raging With Russia for Key Ukrainian City

author: Dan Murtaugh, Stephen Stapczynski
description: US President Donald Trump said China would purchase more US energy as part of a wider trade truce, and hinted at an unspecified “very large scale” transaction involving Alaskan oil and gas.
title: Trump Says China to Purchase More US Energy, Touts Alaska Deal

author: Michael Riley
description: A Silicon Valley startup called Oklo is leading the charge to bring nuclear power back to the US with small reactors. Its backers have wealth and political connections that could undermine nuclear safety.
title: The Risky Movement to Make America Nuclear Again

author: Erik Wasson, Steven T. Dennis
description: Senators failed this week to resolve a standoff over funding food aid during the government shutdown and plan to head home Thursday for a long weekend, leaving millions of low-income Americans struggling to purchase groceries starting Saturday.
title: Food Aid for Millions at Risk as Senators Leave for Long Weekend

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez denied any knowledge of criminal activities involving two close advisers at the start of an hours-long hearing before a Senate committee on government contracts and corruption.
title: Spain’s Sánchez Denies Illegal Party Payments in Senate Hearing

author: Khuleko Siwele
description: South Africa will on Friday start offering loans from a 2.5 billion rand ($135 million) Youth Fund aimed at supporting small businesses, part of a push by the government to tackle one of the world’s highest unemployment rates.
title: South Africa to Start $135 Million Fund to Tackle Unemployment

author: Ellen Milligan
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves has apologized for renting out her family home without a license after entering office last year.
title: UK’s Reeves Apologizes for License Error Over Her London House

author: Mark Anderson
description: Beijing pledged to work with Washington to resolve the fate of TikTok’s US business, stopping short of saying it’s agreed to a deal touted by President Donald Trump to spin off ByteDance Ltd.’s crown jewel.
title: China Says It Will Work With the US on Resolving TikTok Issue

author: Mackenzie Hawkins
description: President Donald Trump’s administration has agreed to a yearlong delay of a sanctions framework that would have dramatically expanded the number of Chinese companies subject to US trade restrictions, according to a readout from China’s Ministry of Commerce.
title: US to Suspend China Sanctions Expansion for a Year, Beijing Says

author: Martin Ritchie
description: China paused plans for a dramatic expansion of its rare-earths export controls, offering relief to global buyers after a tumultuous year and handing major economies more time to counter Beijing’s grip on the industry.
title: China Says Planned Rare-Earth Export Curbs Paused for a Year

author: Patrick Van Oosterom, Katharina Rosskopf, Wout Vergauwen
description: The centrist Democrats 66 party looked set to play a key role in forming a new Dutch government as its support nearly tripled in Wednesday’s parliamentary election.
title: Dutch Voters Turn to Centrists as Far-Right Support Falls

author: Paul Richardson
description: Tanzania’s government ordered civil servants to remain home after protests erupted across the country against presidential elections on Wednesday that excluded the main opposition leaders.
title: Tanzania Orders Public Servants to Stay Home After Vote Unrest

author: Weilun Soon
description: Washington will delay discussions with Beijing over the roll-out of higher port fees on Chinese ships visiting the US, a move that was aimed at challenging the Asian nation’s shipbuilding dominance.
title: US Delays China Port-Fee Talks as Focus Turns to Shipbuilding

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Former Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda said that the yen is likely to strengthen to around 120 to 130 to the dollar, as the interest rate gap between Japan and the US is expected to narrow sooner or later.
title: Ex-BOJ Governor Kuroda Sees Yen Rally Toward 120-130 Per Dollar

author: Lars Paulsson, Charlie Duxbury
description: Residents of Kiruna must move because of an expanding mine
title: Europe’s Raw-Material Needs Push Thousands Out of Home in Sweden

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Brian Platt
description: US President Donald Trump said he had a “very nice conversation” Wednesday with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney, despite the latest increase in tensions over trade between the two nations.
title: Trump Has ‘Very Nice’ Talk With Carney After Canada Rift

author: Hallie Gu
description: US President Donald Trump said China pledged to purchase “tremendous” amounts of American soybeans following a meeting to hammer out a wide-ranging trade deal with his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping.
title: Trump Says China to Buy ‘Tremendous’ Amounts of US Soybeans

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand has asked President Donald Trump for a “better” trade deal as the two countries press ahead with tariff talks following a US-brokered peace agreement between Bangkok and Phnom Penh.
title: Thailand Seeks Better Trade Deal After Trump-Brokered Peace Pact

author: Martin Ritchie
description: Rare earths buyers around the world will have to accept premium prices to get secure and stable supplies from outside China, according to the head of Australia’s Lynas Rare Earths Ltd., one of the few major producers of the key metals outside the Asian nation.
title: Rare Earths Buyers Must Pay More to Cut China Risks, Lynas Says

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump said he had an “amazing meeting” with Chinese President Xi Jinping and would reduce fentanyl tariffs from 20% to 10% effective immediately.
title: Trump Says ‘Amazing’ Xi Meeting Yielded Fentanyl Tariff Cut

author: Toru Fujioka
description: The Bank of Japan kept its benchmark rate unchanged with two dissenters calling for a rate hike at its first meeting since Sanae Takaichi, an advocate of monetary easing, became prime minister last week.
title: Bank of Japan Sits Tight With Two Holdouts

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump said he and Chinese President Xi Jinping would have “a very successful meeting” on Thursday to quell an expansive trade fight that has shaken global markets.
title: Trump, Xi Kick Off Pivotal Trade Talks at South Korea Summit

author: Patrick Van Oosterom, Katharina Rosskopf, Wout Vergauwen
description: The progressive Democrats 66 party was on track to win the Dutch parliamentary election after voters dealt a blow to Geert Wilders’ far-right Freedom Party and threw support behind mainstream political groups.
title: Dutch Far-Right Party Falls in Election as Centrists Set to Win

author: Derek Wallbank
description: President Donald Trump said the US would accelerate its nuclear weapons testing, after Russia in recent days announced trials of a nuclear-powered underwater drone and nuclear-capable cruise missile.
title: Trump Orders Nuclear Weapons Trials After Russia Tests

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: President Donald Trump approved plans for South Korea to build a nuclear-powered submarine at a US shipyard about a day after Seoul pressed Washington to obtain nuclear fuel for submarines.
title: Trump Greenlights Building Nuclear-Powered Sub for South Korea
